event.title: was settled during the frontier days

data.event: The ghost town was settled during the frontier days of 1875 as a mining camp until abandoned in 1896.

event.title: 1875 as a mining camp until abandoned

data.event: The ghost town was settled during the frontier days of 1875 as a mining camp until abandoned in 1896.

Alexandra was founded by E.G. Peck, the owner of the Peck Mine, a famous mining company at the time, T.M. Alexander, William Cole and a man named C.C. Bean. One day in June 1875 while walking through the Bradshaw Mountains, Peck noticed a peculiar rock partly underground.

event.title: built his own mill at Alexandra in 1877

data.event: This became troublesome so eventually Peck built his own mill at Alexandra in 1877.

event.title: A year later a post office was established

data.event: A year later a post office was established.
Alexandra was lively until litigation problems began and by 1879 the town was mostly uninhabited and remained so for years.
Alexandra was lively until litigation problems began and by 1879 the town was mostly uninhabited and remained so for years.
The post office closed in 1896 but in 1903, a new mine shaft was founded at Peck Mine.

event.title: 1903, a new mine shaft was founded

data.event: The post office closed in 1896 but in 1903, a new mine shaft was founded at Peck Mine.
